ovdesc.p: PV.MANAGEMENT is required to define the frequency for the Classification and the Provision Calculation process, and the selection of records to be processed.
The selection criteria is by Application, whereby a range of Category or Product.Group (for AA), may be defined. There should be no duplication in the range selected.
Each Application is linked to a Classification rule (i.e. a link to the T24 Rules Engine), or Classification API which will determine how a classification is derived for a contract.
Each range of contracts selected may be linked to :

i) A Provisioning profile (PV.PROFILE) to determine the Calculation method (IFRS or Standard Provision) and Parameters. This means that a single contract can only have 1 type of provision allowed. You cannot do both IFRS and Standard Provision on the same contract
ii) A classification level to define whether the classification for a contract applies or the worst classification for the Customer
b) To define the Frequency for the Classification process and Calculation process
c) A time delay is allowed for the Posting where, the provision will be calculated again and posted
The following will be allowed in the next phase
b) Filtering the Selection by Customer

desc.p: Holds the frequency at which the assets are to be classified. Classification Job, PV.CLASSIFICATION will run on this frequency if defined, else by considering JOB.FREQUENCY.
Used when the classification frequency is different from the job frequency.
Validation Rules:

p.p: Should not be same or greater than JOB.FREQUENCY
Allowed frequencies are DAILY, BSNSS, WEEKLY, TWMTH and MONTHLY.

desc.p: For future use.
Dictates whether each loan's individual classification will be used for provisioning or whether a customer's worst classification of the loans in the job will be used for all of the loans in the job.
This is the default setting if not defined at Application Level.
The Options are
LOAN : If individual's classification is used
CUSTOMER: If worst classification for customer is used

Specifies a recurrence pattern for a scheduled job. Classification Job, PV.CLASSIFICATION will run on this frequency if CLASS.FREQUENCY is not defined. Based on the this, calculation and posting job will run.
If CLASS.FREQUENCY is defined, then CLASS.FREQUENCY takes the precedence for arriving next frequency to perform classification job.
